intro: Hemsleya kunmingensis, commonly known as the Kunming hemslay, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
